result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Hamm IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Misdemeanor), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.  Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 15CF39

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Per written request. Notice of Intent to Refer Debt sent with letter to DE. Given to Dispatcher K. Meyer. ap

No appearance by the party; court finds party in contempt of court.  Court orders arrest and commitment to the county jail for 110 days on each case consecutive to each other; party may purge by paying amount owed. ap

Defendant William C. Hamm in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant William C. Hamm in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders 30 days county jail with huber and good time consecutive to 15CF39; court costs and DNA sample and surcharge.  2 days sentence credit. - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant William C. Hamm in court, in custody with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to the charge.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  - rt
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

ADR began at 4:19 p.m.  Defendant William C. Hamm in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking.    Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Defendant does not have a current address.  Court questions defendant.  Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking.  Court orders warrant quashed.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  ADR ended at 4:22 p.m.  - rt
Per TC Jail, DE in custody on warrant.
